RECORD.TEXT: CTMC Discharge Summary Report Status : She first presented in April of 1990 with abdominal pain and ultimately was diagnosed with a Duke 's B2 tumor in her transverse colon and had a transverse colectomy with reanastomosis . She then represented in March of 1996 with rectal bleeding and was found to have a tumor 15 cm from the anal verge in the distal sigmoid colon . At the time of surgery there was no evidence of liver disease . Pathology showed moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma invading through the muscularis puerperia . One of ten lymph nodes was positive for tumor . She was therefore staged Dukes C2 . She began adjuvant chemotherapy coupled with pelvic radiation . An MRI was performed on 6/25/96 to rule out cord compression and showed no evidence of cord compression . However , they were unable to rule out a soft tissue abnormality at L5 encroaching on a neural foramen . She presented to the Retelk County Medical Center Emergency Room on 7/8/96 with complaints of several days of lower abdominal pain , nausea , anorexia and low grade temperatures . (8) Status post total abdominal hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient was admitted to the Surgical Service under the care of Dr. Lenni Pain . An abdominal CT scan with oral contrast did not show any evidence for fluid collection or abscess . These findings were felt to be consistent with radiation enteritis . She was admitted and made NPO . On admission , her white count was 15,000 with an absolute neutrophil count of 1,000 . She was initially afebrile and hemodynamically stable . Her ANC dropped to about 200 over the next 48 hours and she developed guaiac positive diarrhea . She was begun on IV antibiotics on admission of mezlocillin , gentamicin and metronidazole . By 7/15/96 she was no longer neutropenic but continued to spike low grade fevers . She was continued on bowel rest and four days prior to discharge she became entirely pain free in her abdomen and was started on TPN . Of note , a PICC line was placed for facilitating the administration of TPN . She was supplemented with Neutra-Phos and her TPN was restarted 18 hours later . We recommend that she continue to rest her bowel for another seven days . After that period of time she should slowly start p.o. intake again starting with clear liquids and in particular avoiding fats and lactose . Her small bowel is likely to be intolerant to lactose for the near future . Insulin sliding scale b.i.d. , lisinopril 10 mg p.o. q. day , Neutra-phos 500 mg p.o. q. day , metopromide 10 mg p.o. q.6h. p.r.n. nausea , nitroglycerin 1/150 tablets one sublingually q. 5 minutes x three p.r.n. chest pain , nizatidine 150 mg p.o. b.i.d. , Ativan 1 mg p.o. q.4h. p.r.n. nausea , nafcillin dose 4 mg in 24 hours , and TPN .
